title: Amazon KDP Niche Research for Beginners to Find Profitable Book Ideas #selfpublishing #booktok

tactics.name: keyword_filtering
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket to identify niches with search demand and low competition by filtering keywords based on search volume and competition metrics.
steps: Start with broad search terms like 'anxiety journal' or 'relationship workbook'.
Explore related keywords and analyze search volume, competition score, and average earnings.
Filter for keywords with >500 monthly searches, <1,000 competing titles, and <100 reviews.
caveats: May miss emerging niches with low search volume but high growth potential
source_quotes: I'm looking for ones with under 100 because that combination usually means there's solid reader demand...

tactics.name: BSR and Review Count Analysis
tactics.description: Identify niches with high BSR and sufficient reviews using KDP data
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to filter niches
caveats: When it fails to show profitable niches
source_quotes: successful authors aren't just writers, they're researchers first

heuristics.name: review_threshold_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is less than 200, then boost the niche
source_quotes: I then go dig into how many average reviews the book has, and I'm looking for ones with under 100

heuristics.name: Review Count Boost
heuristics.condition: If median_reviews is below 200, boost potential
source_quotes: successful authors aren't just writers, they're researchers first

claims.statement: Amazon's search algorithm prioritizes books with high search volume and low competition
source_quotes: If you publish in a niche with too much competition... your book is going to show up against tens of thousands of results

claims.statement: Successful KDP authors prioritize market research over writing
source_quotes: successful authors aren't just writers, they're researchers first

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with targeted problems and unique constraints to create niche opportunities
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Targets underserved markets with demonstrated search demand but limited competition
source_quotes: one of my books came from a niche that barely showed up on Amazon, but it had steady search demand
